message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM

This paper deals with image captioning, which is a computer vision task, and specifically focuses on the language generation aspect of it, which falls under natural language processing. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). However, since the paper also deals with language generation, it could also belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper proposes a technique to get rid of gender bias, which involves training a gender-neutral image captioning model and a gender classifier, which falls under machine learning, and specifically deep learning. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper deals with bias in data annotation, which is a common problem in AI, and could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed technique on image captioning datasets, which is a common evaluation metric in multimedia research, and could fall under cs.MM (Multimedia).
